recipes.recipe_description: A high-protein twist on the classic Italian Chicken Parmesan, perfect for a satisfying and nutritious meal.
recipe_instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a shallow dish, mix together the breadcrumbs, Parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper.
Dip each chicken breast in the breadcrumb mixture, coating both sides.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Brown the chicken breasts on both sides, about 3-4 minutes per side.
Place the browned chicken breasts in a baking dish. Top each breast with marinara sauce, mozzarella cheese, and chopped basil.
Bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the cheese is bubbly.
Serve hot and enjoy!

recipes.recipe_description: A hearty and protein-rich twist on traditional Italian lentil soup, perfect for a cozy and nutritious meal.
recipe_ingredients: 1 cup green or brown lentils, rinsed
4 cups low-sodium chicken or vegetable broth
recipe_instructions: In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add the onion, carrots, celery, and garlic. Cook until vegetables are softened, about 5-7 minutes.
Add the lentils, diced tomatoes, broth, oregano, basil, salt, and pepper. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until lentils are tender.
Taste and adjust seasoning if needed.
Serve hot, topped with grated Parmesan cheese.
Enjoy this nutritious and delicious soup!

recipes.recipe_name: Italian Turkey and Quinoa Stuffed Bell Peppers
recipes.recipe_description: These protein-packed Italian stuffed bell peppers are a healthy and flavorful meal option that the whole family will love.
recipe_ingredients: 4 bell peppers, halved and seeds removed
recipe_instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add the ground turkey and cook until browned.
In a large bowl, mix together the cooked turkey, quinoa, diced tomatoes, mozzarella cheese, parsley, Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper.
Stuff each bell pepper half with the turkey and quinoa mixture.
Place the stuffed bell peppers in a baking dish and cover with foil.
Bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the peppers are tender.
Serve hot and enjoy this delicious and protein-rich meal!

recipes.recipe_description: A light and refreshing high-protein Italian salad featuring chickpeas, perfect for a quick and nutritious meal.
recipe_instructions: In a large bowl, combine the chickpeas, cucumber, cherry tomatoes, red onion, parsley, and basil.
In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, red wine vinegar, oregano, salt, and pepper to make the dressing.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to combine.
Serve the salad topped with crumbled feta cheese.
Enjoy this delicious and protein-rich Italian chickpea salad!

recipes.recipe_description: These Italian-inspired eggplant roll-ups are rich in protein and flavor, making them a satisfying and nutritious meal option.
recipe_ingredients: 1 pound ground lean beef or turkey
recipe_instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add the ground beef or turkey and cook until browned.
In a bowl, mix together the ricotta cheese, Parmesan cheese, egg, chopped basil, salt, and pepper.
On each eggplant slice, spread a layer of the ricotta mixture and a spoonful of the cooked meat. Roll up the eggplant and place seam-side down in a baking dish.
Pour marinara sauce over the eggplant roll-ups and sprinkle with additional Parmesan cheese.
Bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the eggplant is tender.
Serve hot and enjoy these delicious high-protein Italian roll-ups!
